page.title: 03THE POWER STATION: TILBURY
page.content: {Tilbury Power Station}supplies all of Tilbury's electricity. It dominates the landscape. Power Station A was built near the River Thames in 1950; it was finished in 1957 so we could have light in school and in our houses. It was built near the Thames because it needs water to operate but it can use oil, gas and coal as fuel. The coal comes from Australia on a big ship. In 1982 Power Station A was closed down and Power Station B came into operation. 446 people work there; 14 of these people have children at our school. The large chimney pots are 185m high and 10m wide. Out in my garden I can hear the Power Station making a noise and I can see the big chimney pots and a little bit of the Power Station.
